programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon turns his focus to cooking amazing food for parties at home, starting with spicy Mexican eggs - great for a brunch party.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon shows us some of the American inspired dishes he loves cooking for his family at home. Recipes include eggs, bacon and hash browns and peanut butter and jam cookies.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon goes full-on to produce great hearty food that packs a deliciously robust punch. Recipes guaranteed to keep you cosy, warm and wonderfully well fed include Welsh rarebit.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: A blind taste test during which each team must determine the taste of pureed baby foods.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs are challenged to make sliders for three burger aficionados.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs pair up for a taste challenge in which the winners receive Vitamix blenders and a trapeze lesson.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs pair must combine two countries' flavors to impress the guest judge, Roy Yamaguchi.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay suggests a few top-down changes to help Mangia Mangia survive.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay must whip Zayna Flaming Grill into shape. Internal struggles and bland food hold back progress.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is caught in the crossfire as a family's feud threatens to close Zayna Flaming Grill for good.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits the Cambridge Hotel, New York, where ex-military man John Imhof and his wife, Tina, own and run the allegedly haunted Cambridge Hotel. General John runs the hotel like a dictatorship, an approach that's driving the staff crazy.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits The Keating, a luxury boutique hotel in San Diego, CA. The Keating's supercar-obsessed owner, Eddie Kaen, has blown millions designing the hotel to look like an Italian sports car, but neglected to spend money on things the guests need.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs compete in the inaugural Spell's Kitchen challenge, with a private pool party as the reward.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs compete in three difficult challenges to prove if they are worthy of a black jacket.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining cooks celebrate their success of making it to the final five.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The final four cook for club-goers who have taken over "Hell's Kitchen."

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches you how to get started cooking amazing food with confidence. Recipes include delicious pork chops with sweet and sour peppers, pan-fried scallops with crunchy apple salad and a tip that will help you keep your knives sharp.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us how to cook with chilli. Recipes include red mullet with sweet chilli sauce, classic jerk chicken and a super simple spicy beef salad.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula and friends are treated to low-country cooking with the Russo brothers.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula "borrows" one of Michael's classic cars for a girl's road-trip picnic to Tybee Island!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Pitmaster Steve Botkin brings traditional outdoor barbecue inside and the smoke into Paula's kitchen

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha offers a potato primer: scalloped potatoes, all-American potato salad, silky potato purée. Plus, crispy-on-the-outside, creamy-on-the-inside smashed potatoes.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Salads are a terrific way to make vegetables your main course. Martha makes frisée aux lardons, chopped salad, Caesar salad, and stacked butter lettuce with citrus vinaigrette.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Enjoy corn in many different forms! Martha demonstrates sweet and savory corn fritters, corn stock, summer corn chowder, and homemade creamed corn.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: E.J. and Meril join dad Emeril to make some of their favorite recipes: grilled almond butter sandwiches with bananas and chocolate, French bread pizza, and Meril's mac and cheese.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: New York City firefighters turn up the heat in Emeril's kitchen: shrimp with rooster sauce over sticky rice and barbecued pork shanks with cheddar jalapeno cornbread.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril prepares oysters and mussels, including oysters on the half shell with three sauces. Plus, Emeril's classic Moules mariniere with pommes frites.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make New Jersey Crumb Buns. Lan makes Cheese Blintzes with Raspberry Sauce.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make Rib Roast with Yorkshire Pudding. Ashley makes a recipe for Lighthouse Inn Potatoes.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Ashley Moore makes perfect Fish and Chips. Christie Morrison makes Julia the ultimate Shrimp Burgers.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula pays homage to Chef Julia Child and prepares a classic Coq au vin.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Jamie Deen finally gets his pork chop as Paula prepares his favorite meal!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Tom Berenger visits Paula for a "Major League" Flank Steak, Scalloped Potatoes that would feed a "Platoon", and Brussels Sprouts that even the "Hatfield's and McCoy's" could agree on.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: A beautifully cooked roast makes a grand centerpiece for any dinner. Martha shares techniques for prime rib roast, crown roast of pork, and stuffed turkey breast.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Chicken, a mainstay of the dinner table, can be prepared in many ways. Martha prepares chicken paillard, chicken pot pie, and spatchcocked chicken.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha prepares onion dishes with different cooking techniques: French onion soup, balsamic-glazed pearl onions, and fried onion rings. Plus, pickled Vidalia and red onions.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Roasting is a technique used for both formal dinners and casual gatherings. Martha makes roast rack of lamb, salt-roasted sea bass, and saffron-roasted chicken wings.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Oodles of noodles! Watch Martha make three of her favorites: Pad Thai, a one pan pasta that's on the table in twenty minutes, and pho, considered Vietnam's national dish.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha demonstrates braising, the technique behind three iconic dishes: Italian specialty osso buco, traditional Irish corned beef, and lamb shanks with aromatic spices.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha transforms rice from plain to extraordinary: crowd-pleasing paella, stuffed peppers, and Persian rice (rice cooked on top of thinly sliced, buttery potatoes).

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon proves it’s possible to make sensational food that doesn’t cost a fortune. Recipes include cinnamon eggy bread with quick stewed apples.
